title: Conis and Pagaya Are Hiding Something
summary: Based on their fearful reactions when discussing God and Upper Yard, some fans theorized that Conis and Pagaya know more about Skypiea's dark secrets than they're revealing to the Straw Hats.
fullText: When Episode 154 first aired, many fans noticed the subtle fear in Conis and Pagaya's voices when warning about Upper Yard and God. Their overly helpful nature combined with this fear led some to theorize they might be spies or informants for the mysterious God, forced to report on visitors from the Blue Sea. The theory suggested that their kindness might be a cover for surveillance, or alternatively, that they desperately wanted to warn the Straw Hats but couldn't speak freely due to God's omniscient observation.

title: Upper Yard Contains Ancient Secrets
summary: Fans theorized that Upper Yard's forbidden status wasn't just about God's rule, but because it contains ancient ruins or secrets related to the Void Century or Poneglyphs.
fullText: Given Robin's presence in the crew and her interest in history, combined with the mysterious forbidden nature of Upper Yard, fans immediately began theorizing that the area might contain Poneglyphs or ruins from the Void Century. The fact that it's called 'The Land Where God Resides' suggested it might have religious or historical significance beyond just being God's palace. Some theorized it could be the original Jaya, blasted into the sky, containing remnants of an ancient civilization.

title: Dials Will Become Important Combat Tools
summary: After seeing the introduction of dial technology, fans predicted that the Straw Hats would eventually acquire and use dials in combat, particularly Nami and Usopp.
fullText: The detailed explanation of dial technology in Episode 154, combined with demonstrations of their various functions, led fans to predict that dials would become important tools for the Straw Hats. Many specifically predicted that Nami, given her quick mastery of the waver, would incorporate dial technology into her combat style. Usopp was also mentioned as a likely candidate due to his inventive nature. Some fans theorized that dials could level the playing field against God's powers.

title: God is a Devil Fruit User with Lightning Powers
summary: Based on the fearful reverence shown toward God and the mention of divine punishment, fans theorized that God must possess overwhelming power, possibly a Devil Fruit that controls lightning or weather.
fullText: The way Conis and Pagaya spoke of God with such absolute fear, combined with mentions of divine punishment from the sky, led many fans to theorize that God possessed a powerful Devil Fruit ability. The most common prediction was a lightning-based Logia fruit, given the association with gods and sky islands. Some fans drew parallels to Thor and Zeus mythology, predicting that God would use lightning as his primary weapon. This would also create an interesting challenge for Luffy, as lightning is one of the few things that can hurt his rubber body.

title: Skypiea's Clouds Are Made of Seastone
summary: When Pagaya explained that pyrobloin from seastone creates the clouds, some fans theorized this might weaken Devil Fruit users or have other important implications.
fullText: Pagaya's explanation that the clouds are created from pyrobloin, a component of seastone, sparked immediate theories about whether this would affect Devil Fruit users. Some fans worried that walking on Island Clouds might weaken Luffy, Chopper, and Robin. Others theorized that this connection to seastone might be why Sky Islands are so isolated and difficult to reach. A subset of fans predicted this detail would become important in combat against God, possibly as a way to neutralize their Devil Fruit powers.
